abstract: President Obama names trusted political adviser Ron Klain to take over government’s response to deadly Ebola virus, as health officials in two states work to track a growing list of people who may have been exposed because of missteps in quarantine and containment; appointment speaks to seriousness of the situation for the administration, which is eager to put the management of the crisis back on track.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and MITCH SMITH
byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise reported from Washington, and Mitch Smith from Akron, Ohio. Reporting was contributed by Michael Schmidt, Julie Hirschfeld Davis, Jonathan Martin and Michael D. Shear from Washington; Alan Blinder from Atlanta; and Manny Fernandez from Dallas.

lead_paragraph: The appointment of Ron Klain, a White House veteran, spoke of the seriousness of the situation for the administration, which hoped to put the management of the crisis back on track.

headline.main: Obama Names Democratic Operative to Coordinate Ebola Response
